And if you break the rules, RIOT has every right to remove the privilege of using a skin you have purchased.

Expanding on this, the way it all works is that it's simply various *services*, not products, that Riot provides to players, whether those services are free to use (such as access to accounts themselves, boards, Hextech Crafting etc.) or "payed-for" (Namely RP, and any purchases made thereof). With that in mind it's not as if the same consumer laws that would apply to something like a toaster (for example) you buy outright would not necessarily apply to this situation (even disregarding the difference of "medium"). Rather, it would be more akin to renting that toaster (which is something that many businesses do) and bottom line is that if you damage that toaster through negligence and/or intentional acts they'll make you pay to fix/replace it (which is something that will be included in the relevant agreements).
People get banned for breaching Terms of Service, they have no legal recompense, so just give it up now.
